titlestmt.titleproper: James and Judith Bogert receipt books 1818-1858
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: James and Judith Bogert receipt books
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: James and Judith Bogert lived in New York City.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of receipt books for James and Judith Bogert. The James Bogert receipt book records business and personal expenditures, 1818-1858. The Judith Bogert receipt book records household and personal expenditures, 1825-1843. Entries include payments for carpentry and masonry work, rent, and taxes. The volumes also include receipts for tuition, expenses and board for Louise and Helen Bradford.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Judith Bogert memoranda book (collection 1224).
